xmlText.h2: Business owners help employees deal with emotional problems
xmlText.p: NEW YORK (AP) — When employees have emotional problems that affect their work and co-workers, it can be some of the hardest situations small business owners and managers face.

Owners juggle competing concerns; they may be worried on a personal level about a troubled staffer's well-being, but they also have a business to run. They also must comply with federal, state and local laws like the Americans with Disabilities Act that prohibit discrimination against disabled workers.

Some owners say they try to be understanding and help staffers who are struggling. Bosses may give these employees flexible schedules and make sure they don't feel overwhelmed. But they also let workers know that there's a job that needs to be done.
